title: Bean-to-Machine Pairing Guide
description: Match your favourite coffee origin and roast level to the ideal Arco machine and grind setting. Different beans have different extraction needs — this guide ensures you get the best out of every bag.
hero_image_alt: A world map made of coffee beans with different roast levels, small Arco machines positioned at key coffee-growing regions

origins.label: Ethiopian Natural
origins.flavour_profile: Blueberry, strawberry, wine, floral. Intensely fruity with heavy body.

origins.label: Ethiopian Washed
origins.flavour_profile: Jasmine, bergamot, lemon, tea-like. Delicate and complex.

origins.label: Kenyan AA/AB
origins.flavour_profile: Blackcurrant, tomato, grapefruit, brown sugar. Bright acidity with juicy body.

origins.label: Colombian
origins.flavour_profile: Caramel, red apple, milk chocolate, nutty. Clean and balanced.

origins.label: Brazilian
origins.flavour_profile: Chocolate, hazelnut, low acidity, creamy body. A classic espresso base.

origins.label: Guatemalan
origins.flavour_profile: Dark chocolate, spice, orange zest, toffee. Complex sweetness.

origins.label: Costa Rican
origins.flavour_profile: Honey, plum, bright citrus, clean finish. Well-balanced.

origins.label: Sumatran / Indonesian
origins.flavour_profile: Earthy, tobacco, dark chocolate, cedar. Full body, low acidity.

origins.label: Italian-Style Blend
origins.flavour_profile: Dark chocolate, roasted nuts, caramel, smoky. Designed for milk drinks.

origins.label: Specialty Espresso Blend
origins.flavour_profile: Varies — typically designed for sweetness, balance, and versatility as espresso.

pairings.rationale: Light-roast Ethiopian naturals need precise temperature control (92-94C) and gentle pre-infusion to avoid channeling. The Dual Boiler's PID precision is ideal.
pairings.grind_setting: Fine — 2-3 clicks finer than a medium roast baseline. Expect 27-32s extraction.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:2.2 to 1:2.5 — slightly longer ratios help develop the fruit notes without sourness.

pairings.rationale: Delicate washed Ethiopians need the same temperature precision as naturals. The Lever is a great option here — manual pressure profiling can highlight floral notes beautifully.
pairings.grind_setting: Fine — similar to natural but aim for slightly shorter shots to preserve delicacy.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:2.0 to 1:2.3 — keep it shorter to preserve the tea-like quality.

pairings.rationale: Kenyan coffees love a bit of pre-infusion to develop their juicy acidity evenly. The Barista Pro's adjustable pre-infusion is excellent for this.
pairings.grind_setting: Medium-fine. Kenyan beans can produce more fines — a slightly coarser grind compensates.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:2.0 to 1:2.5 — experiment within this range to balance brightness and body.

pairings.rationale: Colombian medium roasts are forgiving and work well on virtually any Arco machine. The Classica is an ideal match — its consistent temperature is all these beans need.
pairings.grind_setting: Standard espresso baseline. This is the reference point for dialing in other origins.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:2.0 — the classic double ristretto-to-normale sweet spot.

pairings.rationale: Brazilian beans are the ultimate crowd-pleaser espresso. Low acidity and creamy body work on every machine. The Automatico shines here — set it and forget it.
pairings.grind_setting: Medium — 1-2 clicks coarser than baseline. Darker roasts extract faster.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:1.8 to 1:2.0 — keep it short for maximum chocolate and nut intensity.

pairings.rationale: Guatemalan coffees have complex sweetness that rewards careful extraction. The Barista Pro's pre-infusion helps develop toffee and spice notes without over-extracting.
pairings.grind_setting: Medium-fine. Slightly finer than Brazilian due to higher density.

pairings.rationale: Honey-processed Costa Ricans benefit from slightly higher temperatures and longer pre-infusion to develop their signature honeyed sweetness.
pairings.grind_setting: Medium-fine. Similar to Guatemalan but can go slightly finer for washed lots.

pairings.rationale: Sumatran dark roasts are best at lower temperatures to avoid ashy bitterness. The Maestro's heat-exchange system provides the stable, moderate temperature these beans prefer.
pairings.grind_setting: Medium-coarse for espresso. Dark Sumatran beans are very porous and extract rapidly.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:1.5 to 1:2.0 — ristretto to short normale highlights the earthy, chocolatey character.

pairings.rationale: Traditional Italian blends are designed for classic machines at moderate temperatures. Any Arco machine will produce authentic Italian-style espresso with these beans. The Lever is particularly fitting.
pairings.grind_setting: Medium. Italian blends are formulated to work at standard settings.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:1.5 to 1:2.0 — short and punchy, as tradition demands.

pairings.rationale: Specialty espresso blends are crafted for versatility. Start at the standard baseline and adjust to taste. Most roasters include brewing guidance on the bag.
pairings.grind_setting: Standard espresso baseline. Follow the roaster's recommendation if provided.
pairings.dose_ratio: 1:2.0 — adjust based on the roaster's tasting notes.
